Subject: Re: [junit] Do we need to convince management of the benefits of unit tests?

>  I still maintain that the biggest problem is that "you get what you
>  reward". Management reward fast development, so they get fast
>  development, together with all of the bugs and problems that accompany
>  it. Support is a matter of throwing the code over the internal wall
>  and letting a different group pull out their hair trying to keep it
>  working. Under this philosophy, anything that isn't writing shipping
>  code is waste. Tests don't ship, so they're waste. Let the suckers in
>  support write tests if they think that'll help.
>
Yes, those darn project budgets... luckily support and maintainance is
free (from the projects perspective) :)
